intro: Jacquemontia selloi f. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered Jacquemontia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and distinctive, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Native to South America, it thrives in moist, shady environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
